intro: Ocotea trichophlebia, commonly known as the white sand ocotea, is a species of flowering plant in the Lauraceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Peru. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically white or greenish-white in color. Ocotea trichophlebia is often found in moist, well-drained soils in lowland and montane forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in these ecosystems.
